metadata.Title: CVE-2019-14824 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the 'deref' plugin of 389-ds-base where it could usethe 'search' permission to display attribute values. In someconfigurations, this could allow an authenticated attacker to view privateattributes, such as password hashes.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-14824` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

389-ds - 1.4.2.4-1
389-ds-base - 1.4.2.4-1
389-ds-base-libs - 1.4.2.4-1
cockpit-389-ds - 1.4.2.4-1
python3-lib389 - 1.4.2.4-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: 389-ds-base package in esm-apps/focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.4.2.4-1').
